thread.title: Trains between Birmingham and Lichfield suspended
thread.title_full: Trains between Birmingham and Lichfield suspended | Central - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Trains between Birmingham and Lichfield suspended
text:
London Midland has suspended all services on the Cross City North route between Birmingham New Street and Lichfield Trent Valley, due to a fault with the overhead electric line.
Train services between Birmingham New Street and Walsall are also affected, with a diversion in place which means trains cannot call at stations between Birmingham New Street and Perry Barr.
All train services on the route will be suspended for the remainder of the day.
Passengers are advised that their rail tickets and passes will be accepted on National Express West Midlands buses for journeys affected by the fault.
For passengers travelling to/from stations between Sutton Coldfield and Lichfield, London Midland say they are arranging replacement road transport services - in both directions.
Network Rail advise the fault should be rectified overnight so that trains will run as scheduled from tomorrow morning.
Passengers are advised to check before they travel.
Last updated Wed 1 Jul 2015 Travel Birmingham West Midlands
